tweets.author: Tech Dev Notes
tweets.text:
xAI is building A Pure AI Software Company, Macrohard

Since companies like Microsoft focus solely on software without producing physical hardware, their operations could theoretically be fully replicated or automated by AI agents working together in a digital environment, like virtual coworkers in simulated machines

"This is a macro challenge and a hard problem with stiff competition" - Elon

Join@xAI

tweets.author: Zeeshan Patel
tweets.text:
Many people wonder what is the benefit of training video gen models. Video gen by itself doesn’t necessarily seem to provide as much raw intelligence to users as modern LLMs. 

However, in the long term, video gen models will be used as neural simulations of the universe within which we can train agents to explore and learn from information rich environments. There are many open problems to solve, but if it works, we’ll eventually have entire datacenters simulating the universe to train superintelligence. If you’d like to join us@xAIto push the frontier of world models / video gen, please reach out!

tweets.author: Elon Musk
tweets.text:
Join@xAIand help build a purely AI software company called Macrohard. It’s a tongue-in-cheek name, but the project is very real!

In principle, given that software companies like Microsoft do not themselves manufacture any physical hardware, it should be possible to simulate them entirely with AI.
